name: Thai Peanut Noodles
description: 20 minutes is all it takes to make Thai Peanut Noodles! This dish is loaded with colorful vegetables and packed with flavor. Gluten free.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce  ((tamari for gluten free))
7 ounces brown rice stir fry noodles
2 cups cabbage or Trader Joe's cruciferous crunch
2  carrots, peeled and chopped into matchsticks

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Peanut Sauce: In a medium bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients until smooth. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Peanut Sauce: In a medium bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients until smooth. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the noodles: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the noodles and cook for 1 minute, then remove from heat and let soak for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse well. (If using other noodles, prepare according to package instructions.)
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the noodles: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the noodles and cook for 1 minute, then remove from heat and let soak for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse well. (If using other noodles, prepare according to package instructions.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the veggies: In the same pot you boiled the noodles in, add a few tablespoons of water (or olive oil). Add the cabbage, carrots, red pepper and green onions and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the veggies: In the same pot you boiled the noodles in, add a few tablespoons of water (or olive oil). Add the cabbage, carrots, red pepper and green onions and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix it all together: Now add the noodles and peanut sauce. Mix until warm and combined. Serve immediately with cilantro and chopped peanuts on top, and more hot sauce if desired. Enjoy!
